triples.name: Bacterial growth
triples.relevance: Paper discusses growth rate as a central fitness strategy and reviews mechanisms controlling bacterial growth

triples.name: Oligotroph
triples.relevance: Paper focuses on explaining why slow-growing oligotrophic microbes are widely distributed despite growth rate being important

triples.name: Evolutionary tradeoff
triples.relevance: Trade-offs between growth and other traits like adaptability and survival are the central mechanistic theme of the paper

triples.name: Bet hedging (biology)
triples.relevance: Paper discusses bet-hedging strategies as mechanisms microbes adopt to improve fitness in fluctuating environments

triples.name: Fitness (biology)
triples.relevance: Fitness is the fundamental concept framing how microbes make strategic trade-offs between growth and survival

triples.name: Phenotype
triples.relevance: Paper title and abstract focus on shaping of microbial phenotypes, which are observable characteristics shaped by trade-offs

triples.name: Coexistence theory
triples.relevance: Paper highlights co-existence of species as one important ecological phenomenon driven by trade-offs

triples.name: Homogeneity and heterogeneity (statistics)
triples.relevance: Paper discusses population heterogeneity as an important ecological phenomenon emerging from microbial trade-offs
